freenet.io.comm
Interface PeerContext

All Known Implementing Classes:
DarknetPeerNode, OpennetPeerNode, PeerNode, SeedClientPeerNode, SeedServerPeerNode, SeedServerTestPeerNode
public interface PeerContext

Author:
amphibian Everything that is needed to send a message, including the Peer. Implemented by PeerNode, for example.

Method Summary
 void forceDisconnect(boolean dump)
          Force the peer to disconnect.
 long getBootID()
          Get the current boot ID.
 OutgoingPacketMangler getOutgoingMangler()
          Get the OutgoingPacketMangler which encrypts outgoing packets to this node
 Peer getPeer()
           
 SocketHandler getSocketHandler()
          Get the SocketHandler which handles incoming packets from this node
 PacketThrottle getThrottle()
          Get the PacketThrottle for the node's current address for the standard packet size (if the address changes then we get a new throttle).
 int getVersionNumber()
          Peer version, if this is supported, else -1
 WeakReference<? extends PeerContext> getWeakRef()
          Get a WeakReference to this context.
 boolean isConnected()
          Is the peer connected? Have we established the session link?
 boolean isRoutable()
          Is the peer connected? are we able to route requests to it?
 void sendAsync(Message msg, AsyncMessageCallback cb, ByteCounter ctr)
          Send a message to the node
 void sendThrottledMessage(Message msg, int packetSize, ByteCounter ctr, int timeout, boolean waitForSent, AsyncMessageCallback callback)
          Send a throttled message to the node (may block for a long time).
 String shortToString()
          Compact toString()
 void transferFailed(String reason)
          Report a transfer failure

void forceDisconnect(boolean dump)
Force the peer to disconnect.

Parameters:
purge - If true, the message queue and trackers will be dumped.

Is the peer connected? Have we established the session link?

               AsyncMessageCallback cb,

sendThrottledMessage

void sendThrottledMessage(Message msg,
                          int packetSize,
                          ByteCounter ctr,
                          int timeout,
                          boolean waitForSent,
                          AsyncMessageCallback callback)
                          throws NotConnectedException,
                                 WaitedTooLongException,
                                 SyncSendWaitedTooLongException,
                                 PeerRestartedException
Send a throttled message to the node (may block for a long time).

Throws:
SyncSendWaitedTooLongException
NotConnectedException - If the peer is disconnected at the time of sending or becomes so later.
PeerRestartedException - If the peer is restarted.
WaitedTooLongException

getBootID

long getBootID()
Get the current boot ID. This is a random number that changes every time the node starts up.

getThrottle

PacketThrottle getThrottle()
Get the PacketThrottle for the node's current address for the standard packet size (if the address changes then we get a new throttle).

getSocketHandler

SocketHandler getSocketHandler()
Get the SocketHandler which handles incoming packets from this node

getOutgoingMangler

OutgoingPacketMangler getOutgoingMangler()
Get the OutgoingPacketMangler which encrypts outgoing packets to this node

getWeakRef

WeakReference<? extends PeerContext> getWeakRef()
Get a WeakReference to this context. Hopefully there is only one of these for the whole object; they are quite expensive.

shortToString

String shortToString()
Compact toString()

transferFailed

void transferFailed(String reason)
Report a transfer failure
